p: Our planet is experiencing dramatic environmental and climatic change. In the past 100 years, anthropogenic activities have raised the concentration of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, leading to an increase in the Earth’s average annual temperature of 0.6 °C ( Parmesan 2006), threatening the integrity of ecosystems ( Walther et al. 2002). Besides global warming, extreme and sudden changes of seasonal temperatures are currently occurring worldwide and, in particular, in the Mediterranean region ( Barros et al. 2014). In this area, climate models predict increasing mean and maximum temperatures and a reduction in precipitation ( Giorgi and Lionello 2008).
